Reviews.Title: “Could do much better”
Reviews.Author: bennett_admin
Reviews.Content: Positives first: The location is fine, in that it is close to Prosperidad metro station, and easy in/out as far as the airport is concerned. Reception staff are pleasant and well informed. There is a free computer in the tiny reception area and free wifi elsewhere. But.... The rooms, whilst tolerably clean, are rather worn and in need of a re-fit. Bedclothes are far from new. The TV only had four channels working, all international cable news rather than domestic and most of those intermittently. The breakfast room is a joke, the kind of thing you might expect in a youth hostel and the replenishment of supplies could not keep pace with demand. I took my meagre fare to the adjacent reception area to find a place to sit down. I found the neighbourhood quite entertaining (and for certain you will not be ripped off in shops or restaurants), but many will find it drab, not the kind of place that they would associate with a holiday. On balance: It is a cheaper option, but it could be so much better within the resources available. There are many other 3-star hotels a great deal better than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel for ok price”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a big triple room (although we were only 2 people). Room was clean, Location very good. The beds were metal made (very cheap ones). The room has a kitchen and microwave (flat like) but I didn't use it. If you want to save, that's a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel but unattractive area”
Reviews.Author: Ed_Paul
Reviews.Content: In itself a pleasant hotel, with apartments large enough for couples or small families. The service is courteous, internet use is free and breakfast is modest yet, I think, adequate. The next room was very noisy on the first night but the remaining three nights were quiet. In fact the whole place struck me as remarkably quiet, even lonely - but I did go there out of season (despite 30-degree heat in Madrid!). My sole objection is to the location. The Calle de Canillas is all right and handy for the airport and also the bus station at Avenida de América (for visits to Cervantes's birthplace, Alcalá de Henares). There is even an attractive-looking garden suburb in another part of the area. However, despite the name Prosperidad, the streets near the hotel are neglected and quite gloomy (hardly likely to improve in this economic climate). I found them pretty depressing. This is the only reason why I am not keen to go back to the hotel. Overall, the trip was very good value at less than £400 all inclusive for four nights.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel, good price, good quality, good location.”
Reviews.Author: MoshUk
Reviews.Content: located 2 mins from a metro station, in a working class neighbourhood surrounded by mechanic garages, schools and shops. round the corner is condis a cheap supermarket. hotel is easy to find. good service from staff, really good rooms. provided a few fork and knives as well as cups. microwave, cooker fridge as well. clean bathroom. tv is spanish only channels but not a problem. would definately recommend it and would stay again if i ever visit madrid. highlight was the fact that it took exaclty 15 minutes to get to the bernabau, and returned to the area at midnight but despite quiet streets didnt feel unsafe at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good facility”
Reviews.Author: PJvj_11
Reviews.Content: Good basic facility. we travelled with a small child and needed basic kitchen facility and this place was perfect. Location is great. 15mins to city centre and 30 mins to airport by train.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: olegkravitz
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location, close to the subway Prosperidad, line 4. Very quiet area of Madrid, low old house, there is little automobile traffic. Likely Togumar former hostel because we had a very large room with a kitchen and satellite TV. Breakfast is not very large selection, but you can eat for unpretentious people. The airport is reached by metro in 25 minutes. I recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not what it's made out to be.....!!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah2394
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, we were given a key to our room and was told it was in the next building behind. We made our way to the building and found the room was on the ground floor overlooking a narrow busy street and the buildings opposite. Straight away we asked for a higher floor and the hotelier looked at us like we were stupid, so we had to make do with that. We noticed that the curtains were flimsy and see through and didnt close properly and that the shower head holder was broken so we either had to hold the shower head in our hands or take a bath, with a plug that would not fit. It was meant to be an aparthotel and although there was a small kichenette, there were no utensils whatsover, not even to make a tea/coffee. We went back to reception to mention the shower head, at which the hotelier just shrugged his shoulders. We also asked for a couple of cups and a kettle or a pan to make a hot drink and we were just told "no cups, you'll have to use the glasses", even though we knew they had plenty of cups in the dining room (if you can call it that). We were then told we could hire a box of utensils for a deposit of 20 euros, which contained a few pans and plastics utensils. So we purcashed a box only to find that there was nothing in there worth using. The next day we decided to stay in our room with the "do not disturb" sign put on the door, but the cleaners still just entered the room with a key 'in pairs,' to clean a room which was so small. The dining room was like a sardine can and the breakfast was limited. We were expecting American buffet breakfast, as stated. It seemed that whatever we asked for, they just werent interested and were very unhelpful. It's a good job we were only there for a few days. On our departure, we returned the box and the room key back to reception expecting to get our 20 euros back as we were told, only to be told that he had no money for us for the box we hired, and knew nothing about the 20 euros that we paid. As our taxi had not yet arrived, we tried talking with him about it but he just kept saying "No". In the end we had to leave without the money, which was not a great deal of money but it was just the principle of the whole thing. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone and certainly would never return!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ayis
Reviews.Content: We stayed from December 26, 2010 until January 5, 2011 and it was really worth it. The location was very much to our liking: off centre, not a posh area, very close to the metro and bus stations-you could even walk to the centre of the city if you felt energetic enough-but above all quiet. The staff were quite friendly and helpful, breakfast was good and the rooms were clean. Very good value for money (we booked our room through a travel agency). The few weaknesses of the hotel included mediocre sound isolation of the rooms (you could hear the dragging of beds in the morning by the cleaning ladies but not really what was going on in the room next door), few kitchen utensils and the size of the room where we had breakfast. Otherwise it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “decent location, dont miss the bernabeu!!!”
Reviews.Author: jonsey_uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in November 2010 and had a pleasent stay. It is a few minutes walk away from metro stop prosperidad and that will take you into central madrid in 10-15 mins. Easy to find basically head straight out of the station go across the crossing and you will walk by a mechanics and bar on your right and a huge wall will be on your left, follow that and turn left at the end of it and head up the street where it will be on your left. The room was a decent size not great facilities however if you want to properly do self catering but there is a lidl next to the metro stop which was handy. Would happily stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in interesting neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: JudyMrr
Reviews.Content: I was grateful for the kitchen, although it was equipped with plates, bowls, silverware, but no pots or pans, which was odd. Instead of curtains, the window had a metal sort of grill, like storefronts have, that rolled to cover the window at the flip of a switch. It blocked both light and sound, so I got a really good sleep, despite the fact that the mattress was a bit lumpy. The size of the room was good, with a slightly separate area for the table and two chairs. It's only a few short blocks from the Prosperidad metro station, so we got to the center of Madrid in 10 or 15 minutes. The neighborhood is modest but interesting, with plenty of restaurants, pubs, etc. We ate well there! Overall, I got the impression that whatever corporation is running Sercotel, it isn't investing as much as it should - the hallways needed a new coat of paint, the mattress needed to be replaced, etc. The staff were helpful and well-trained.

Reviews.Title: “Not really an aparthotel”
Reviews.Author: Bicholisto
Reviews.Content: This is a dated "comfort class" Sercotel in the untouristy working class suburb of Prosperidad in NE Madrid 5-10 mins walk from the metro. We booked an aparthotel as we were staying for 12 nights and needed space to work and cook. Unfortunately the kitchen had been "retired" (i.e. no utensils, plates, cooking gear or kitchen table) and there was no work desk: just a round glass table with 2 uncomfortable chairs. When we asked about the kitchen we were shown an alternative room on the ground floor which was dark and depressing, and when we asked about whether any rooms had a work desk we were told "no". So we concluded that this was not really what it pretended to be (an aparthotel) and so made do but would never return. The good news was that our room was at the back and very quiet. There were other, more minor, complaints (like being given only one small bar of soap for the entire 12 days, combined with an obvious reluctance to provide more shampoo/gel - we used our own), but I think I have said enough. For guests staying off-season for 12 nights they should have made more of an effort for us. Maybe suitable for a short citybreak if you get a good price (we paid just under Euro 70/night which is not especially cheap for November), but I would look elsewhere first.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but could be cleaner”
Reviews.Author: basak83
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Sercotel Togumar for a week, while I looked for an apartment to rent in Madrid. The staff is polite and generally helpful, and the location is great - not in the middle of everything, but in a good neighborhood and 2 minutes from the Prosperidad metro station. Very safe at night - had no problems as a solo female traveler. The rooms could be better. They are very spacious and the bathroom was clean. But they are old and gloomy. I am fairly sure that they never changed my sheets during the 7 nights I was there (the sheets had a tiny stain, which is how I understood they never changed them). One day my towel had a big black stain on it - not very pleasant. And I found a 2-3 tiny flies under the covers - also not great. Otherwise, no problems. I like my rooms impeccably clean - and I am picky about checking everything to make sure they are clean - so I might be judging harshly, but the rooms could be cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a safe, quiet location close to Metro”
Reviews.Author: dinojo
Reviews.Content: If you don't need or want to be around the Sol/Plaza Mayor activity, Sercotel Togumar is a great place to stay away from the crowds. It is near the Metro stop Prosperidad. If you have breakfast there, you will enjoy some of the best croissants I've ever eaten. They are made on site. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are not luxurious but are light and airy and have kitchenettes. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good budget hotel between airport and centre”
Reviews.Author: thefrancophile
Reviews.Content: we booked through alpharooms - only £308 for 7 nights b&b. hotel is only 5 mins to metro, then approx 15/20 mins to centre or airport. beware of pickpockets on metro ! - i suffered this fate, but only lost a map of metro. not too many restaurants close by- we asked receptionist to recommend some - the first one was closed and the second one did not serve food until 9pm - so we returned to our room and used the kitchenette - very useful. there is a lidl supermarket next to the metro which is very good value. took a trip to el escorial by bus, which was excellent. also visited toledo - went by train which was about 35 euros return for 2. would have no hesitation staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay for exploring Madrid”
Reviews.Author: ricapex
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights there. We got a small welcome gift. Parking was available both outside hotel and in hotel's garage. English speaking staff was also very friendly and helped us with everything we asked for. Free wireless internet was available, as well as safe in the room. Very quiet neighborhood, yet very close to two metro stations - Prosperidad and Cartagena. The only downside was the lack of spoons and forks, but we didn't need more than there was available.

Reviews.Title: “Practical hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: mumucienta
Reviews.Content: We stayed 11 days at Sercotel and it was very price-location convenient hotel. It is 2 blocks from the subway (line 4), in a very calm neighbourhood. The room has kitchenette so you can cook yourself and have your own breakfast (if you want the hotel´s breakfast it is 5 Usd per person). Room Service comes everyday but they do not clean the kitchen. Hotel provides complimentary wi-fi which is great. Bathroom is big and has a bidet. It´s a nice hotel for a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but out of the way”
Reviews.Author: I-Hate-Carolina
Reviews.Content: A friend and I booked the Barcelona-Madrid holiday through a travel company and stayed at the Togamar Apartments in Madrid. We knew that it was not close to the City Center, but had no idea it was so far away from all the major attractions. If a person doesn't mind staying a good distance from the City Center, in a neighborhood with very few restaurants (but a great pastry shop!), and at a hotel where only one employee spoke English, then you might enjoy this facility. The rooms facing the street are very noisy (and cars driving over the metal plate placed over the street repair didn't help the noise level!), so ask for a room at the extension at the rear of the hotel. The continental breakfast is average. Rooms are good size and large bathroom. But, again, the location is very far out and not close to any of the sites. Few taxi drivers are familiar with this area. If I had to do it over, I'd pay more for closer accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: woohoo650
Reviews.Content: My bestfriend & I stayed at the Togumar Sercotel Apartamentos (it was listed as a hotel) on 11/8 - 11/10/06. When we got there, we thought the driver was kidding....we couldn't believe that this was our hotel. Front desk - tiny although the front desk person was a bit helpful. The elevator was tiny as well, we are 2 tiny girls with 2 big and 2 small luggage and we barely fit! Rooms...very outdated with Thai decor?? It did have a kitchenette, which we did not use. The rooms also do NOT have A/C but it did have a heater so we had to leave the windows open for fresh air. We got 2 twin beds, which were okay as far as comfort. View is non-existent. Be careful when you walk the streets outside the "hotel" since they were littered with garbage and dog poop. Lots of cute dogs but people didn't seem to care or clean up after thier dogs. We did not feel threatened to walk outdoors, being 2 females, but we did turn in early (before 10pm) the 3 nights we were there. Bathroom - clean but be careful of the shower head. It is a hand-held shower head and the shower curtain was smaller than the whole tub. It's so easy to get the floor wet since the shower head did not have anything to hang it on and since the curtain was short, whatever's exposed will get wet. The walls were very thin and I heard everything our neighbors next door or upstairs did. Our last night there (Fri), we had to get up at 4:45am and good thing we did because at 5am, a couple of drunk men tipped all the garbage cans over and intentionally scraped the walls outside the buildings so to wake everyone up in the neighborhood. The complimentary breakfast was okay...consisted of pastries, some cold cuts, breads, coffe, tea, and juice. Distance to Puerta del Sol was probably less than 10 minutes or more, depending on the traffic. It costs less than 10 euros one way. There were some shops located within a short distance. Do not forget to check out the "churreria" where they served churros and hot, thick chocolate. There are a lot of bars/restaurants also nearby. However, I will not stay here again - it was probably the worst hotel/motel I've ever stayed in. Overall, if you are just looking to rest your head or somewhere to crash, it's an okay place to stay. Otherwise, stay away.

HotelInfo.Name: Sercotel Togumar
HotelInfo.Address: Canillas 59, 28002 Madrid, Spain
